page.title: 12THE EFFECT OF THE BRIDGE
page.content: IN 1971 THE BURRA BRIDGE WAS OPENED AND IT AFFECTED BURRA LIFE GREATLY. SOME PEOPLE WERE HAPPY ABOUT IT SOME WERE NOT.ONE OF THE ADVANTAGES WAS THAT THE DOCTOR WAS ABLE TO COME MORE OFTEN.YOU DID NOT NEED TO GO TO LERWICK IN A BOAT NOW YOU COULD JUST GO IN A CAR. SOME PEOPLE WERE UNHAPPY ABOUT THE BRIDGE.IN FACT A LOT OF MEN LOST THEIR JOBS BECAUSE THEIR JOB WAS FERRYING THE PEOPLE WHO WERE GOING TO LERWICK TO DO THEIR SHOPPING. AS A RESULT OF THE BRIDGE THE POPULATION HAS INCREASED TREMENDOUSLY AS BEFORE THERE WAS LITTLE OPPORTUNITY FOR EMPLOYMENT IN BURRA.HOWEVER,WITH THE COMING OF THE BRIDGE PEOPLE WERE NOW ABLE TO TRAVEL TO ANY OTHER PARTS OF THE ISLANDS WHENEVER THEY WISHED.THIS HAS PROBABLY BEEN THE MOST SIGNIFICANT EVENT IN THE LIVES OF BURRA FOLK.
